Relator Minister Alexandre de Moraes opened the voting on November 7, 2025, casting a vote that rejected all defense arguments and reaffirmed Bolsonaro’s 27-year and 3-month prison sentence. The previously discussed amnesty agenda has been abandoned, with no one now mentioning it. The defense’s current strategy is to delay proceedings through procedural motions like declarations of clarification and dilatory appeals, potentially pushing the final judgment into the judicial recess from December to January 2026. This would aim to delay prison execution until the 2026 election year, when political conditions might favor Bolsonaro—though such a move is deemed unlikely. Despite minimal chances, the STF is expected to confirm the sentence’s enforcement this year. Bolsonaro is anticipated to serve a few days in closed regime, possibly at Papuda Prison in Brasília, before obtaining house arrest due to health reasons, similar to Fernando Collor. The CPI will also hear from federal and state authorities and investigate the operations of criminal factions and militias nationwide. The program 'Sem Rodeios' on November 6, 2025, will feature state deputy Ana Campagnolo (PL-SC), Tagliaferro’s lawyer with updates on the Italian case, and pastor Silas Malafaia for a frank political discussion.
